descript.abstract: The North Carolina State Center for Health Statistics in cooperation with the Division of Facility Services in the Department of Health and Human Services, developed the GIS data set, Medical Facility Point Locations, to identify locations of health and medical facilities for the entire State of North Carolina. Point locations were geocoded from the facilities database provided by the Division of Facility Services.
descript.purpose: This data set was created to locate health and medical facilities (including hospitals) for the State of North Carolina.

cntorgp.cntorg: NC State Center for Health Statistics, Division of Public Health, Department of Health & Human Services

idinfo.datacred: NC State Center of Health Statistics and the Division of Facility Services, Department of Health and Human Services.

attracc.attraccr: Point attributes were supplied by the Division of Facility Services in the Department of Health and Human Services.

dataqual.logic: 5,379 of the 7,159 addresses had match rates of 100%. Match rates lower than 100% were also considered a match because variables such only had minor errors. The address table and the road file did not coincide because of the currentness of the address table. Minor errors detected from either the road file or the address table include incorrect zip codes, incomplete address ranges and inconsistant road name formats. Addresses with no address ranges were geocoded to the closest road intersection. Addresses with discrepancies and/or improper formats were simply corrected and matched. 352 addresses had zero match rates because roads were non-existant in the road file. Several problems attributed to addresses having zero percent match rates include non-existant roads, non-existant road address ranges and improper zip codes. Facilities with rural routes and post office box addresses also had a zero percent match rate.

procstep.procdesc: The database was geocoded or "addressmatched" using GDT, Inc. Dynamap for NC (from OCT 02). The addressmatching was done using ArcView 3.2

cntorgp.cntorg: NC State Center for Health Statistics, DHHS, DPH

overview.eaover: A point shapefile representing locations of medical and health facilities for the State of North Carolina. Facility attributes were provided by the Division of Facility Services of the Department of Health and Human Services. Geographic attributes include entity ID and shape geometry. Software defined variables created when geocoding include variables starting with AV, then followed by an underscore.

cntorgp.cntorg: NC Center for Geographic Information and Analysis

distinfo.distliab: NCCGIA is charged with the development and maintenance of NC OneMap and, in cooperation with other mapping organizations, is committed to offering its users accurate, useful, and current information. Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors and conditions originating from physical sources used to develop this dataset may be reflected in the data supplied. The user must be aware of possible conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, original map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other conditions specific to certain data. NCCGIA does not support secondary distribution of this dataset without its current, compliant metadata record. The use of trade names or commercial products does not constitute their endorsement by NCCGIA or North Carolina State Government.

stdorder.fees: None. Download from http://www.nconemap.gov is free of charge.

cntorgp.cntorg: North Carolina Center for Geographic Information and Analysis

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is to accompany the dataset. NCCGIA does not support secondary distribution of this dataset without its current, compliant metadata record. If the dataset described in this metadata record was received from anyone besides NCCGIA, this metadata and the dataset it describes may contain discrepancies.
